doc.after: An early quick-firing field gun was created by Vladimir Baranovsky in 1872-5[4] which was officially adopted by the Russian military in 1882.[5] On land, quick-firing field guns were first adopted by the French Army, starting in 1897 with the Canon de 75 modÃ¨le 1897 which proved to be extremely successful. Other nations were quick to copy the quick-firing technology.
